lexUnit.name: glint.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give out or reflect small flashes of light.

sentence.text: Nearly breaking her neck , the pony pulled away in panic , the whites of her eyes glinting in the moonlight , coat curled with dried sweat like an Irish Water Spaniel .
His face was flushed , his eyes glinting with excitement ; he seemed to be having difficulty breathing , too , and he spoke so rapidly that he slurred his words .
The little grey eyes glinted again .
His dark eyes glinted in the candlelight , but was it with amusement or anger ?
Her sapphire-blue eyes glinting with anger , Laura glared after his tall figure .
` You see -- we did n't wake the children , after all , " Ross drawled , his eyes glinting with amusement as he gazed warmly down at the soft figure in his arms .
Hands still held to her mouth , tears glinted in her frightened eyes .
The overhead strip lights glinted in the blackness of his eyes .
She shook her head , the dark hair glinting with moisture , her eyes turned to me and searching mine .
A dangerous light glinted in his eyes , small lines flared around the corners of his mouth , and his colour was slightly heightened .
` Men , " he repeated , sardonic amusement glinting in his eyes .
The wet stone glinted yellow with a reflection of the embankment lights above .
He laughed , his teeth glinting white , ` Very well , my treasure , but the answer 's still the same .
He had his arm around her shoulder , her amazing hair glinted in the candlelight .
The other laughed , a swift recovery , white teeth glinting in the brown face .
We are back with Miss Miniver , her glasses glinting in the firelight .
Sometimes Eudo had glimpsed the French King , his blond hair glinting in the guttering torchlight .
He stood up , sunlight glinting in his sun-bleached hair .
I wondered if she might ever get frostbite ; I was sure I could see little crystals of ice glinting on her faint moustache .
A tall woman in a loose blue calico wrap , her ankles and wrists glinting with gold in the sun , squatted on the dusty ground .
But her smile was bright and her eyes -- as blue as Nicolo 's -- glinted with happiness .
She looked at the coins glinting against his palm , then at him .
His burnished armour glinted in the light of the setting sun .
The torchlight flickered over gilt lettering at the top of the gate and the two words ` GREY FRIARS " glinted briefly before disappearing into the darkness again .
The brief smile glinted again .
Ruby , however , meant to walk the opposite way and glided proudly up Fleet Street , purple headscarf bobbing and gold hooped earrings glinting cruelly .
She went over to the shelf where she had left her drink , and stared down in dismay at the overturned glass , the shards of crystal glinting wickedly up at her in the dim light .
Jaws dropped , spectacle lenses glinted as heads turned …
